abstract.p: Personal Shopper column on sources and prices of gold-covered upholstery fabrics, housewares and tableware; photos (M)

block.p: MUCH of what will glitter this fall will be gold. ''Gold is a neutral color that is warm and flattering, like candlelight,'' said Sherri Donghia, the design director of Donghia Furniture and Textiles. ''Gold is no longer a color just for holidays.''

Nor is it appropriate only in traditional settings. Now, some futuristic fabrics used for spacesuits and running shoes are gold colored and show up as modern upholstery fabrics. Unlike the cool metallics of the 1960's, the choices this time around are a warm gold tone (matte or shiny) or subtle molten tones in leather, textiles, wall paint and tiles. Bisazza, the Italian tile company, reports selling more gold tiles in the first seven months of this year than in all of last year. Its three-quarter-inch-square mosaic tiles, called Oro, cost $428 a square foot.

Larry Bogdanow, an architect in New York, upholstered the banquettes and chairs of the Dining Room, a new restaurant on the Upper East Side, in gold fabric and painted some walls with gold paint. (Janovic Plaza sells seven shades of gold paint, from $68 to $98 a gallon.) ''Gold is a state of mind,'' Mr. Bogdanow said. But remember, a little goes a long way.

1. A bed is dressed from head to foot in gold satin; a queen-size bed with quilted headboard, $4,500; quilted pillowcases, $250 to $425; a comforter, $1,950; by Ann Gish; at ABC Carpet & Home, 888 Broadway (19th Street).

2. Bestlite by Baldinger is a reproduction of a Bauhaus-style floor lamp originally made in England in the mid-1900's by Best & Lloyd. An original (in chrome) is in the Victoria and Albert Museum in London. In gold-tone, $606 at Lightforms, 509 Amsterdam Avenue (85th Street). The headboard is a rattlesnake-pattern embossed leather; $16 a square foot from Edelman Leather, (800) 886-8339 for locations. Thai Stripes, a Euro-square pillow sham by Archipelago, is all silk; $250 at Takashimaya, 693 Fifth Avenue (55th Street).
3. Presto-Change-O polyurethane fabric, a material used in the Dining Room restaurant, changes from gold to green; $75 a yard at Design Tex, 200 Varick Street (Houston Street).

4. A throw-pillow cover in cotton, lower left, in an abstract pattern primarily in gold, is $70 at Crate & Barrel; www.crateandbarrel.com; (800) 967-6696. Look, a wool, nylon and polyester blend on the wall, was designed by Dorothy Cosonas for Unika Vaev; $44 a yard at ICF, 920 Broadway (22nd Street). A mirror in a 20-inch-diameter frame made of 24-karat gold and glass mosaic tiles by Bisazza is $2,500 at Bisazza, 12 West 23rd Street. Gold leather (on top cushion and on floor) is from a collection of eight gold tones, from shiny to matte, and embossed, from Edelman; $16 a square foot. On the ottoman, Omen, a cotton-blend damask, woven in France, is $93 a yard at Donghia, 979 Third Avenue (58th Street). The matte-gold leather ottoman is $340 at Room, 182 Duane Street (Hudson Street).
5. A golden glass tumbler is $14 at Barneys New York Chelsea Passage, 660 Madison Avenue (61st Street); (800) 777-0087. A ceramic soup bowl ($85) and porcelain soup spoon ($35) are at Takashimaya.

6. From left: white-and-gold-striped sheer-silk fabric, $15 a yard at Joe's Fabric Warehouse, 108 Orchard Street (Delancey Street); sheer gold-colored cashmere is $225 a yard at Donghia, to the trade only; Network, a new sheer designed by Jack Lenor Larson, is woven of linen, silk and gold metallic fibers, $156 at Cowtan & Tout, 979 Third Avenue, to the trade.

7. From top, Chloe and Double Dot wallpapers are $75 a roll or $15 a yard, by Architectonic in Yonkers; (914) 969-4363. Brocatello, a linen and metallic brocade, is $210 at Cowtan & Tout. On bottom, a gold silk and Lurex fabric, $35 a yard at Joe's Fabric Warehouse.

8. A thermal carafe by Alfi in gold tone in three sizes -- half a liter ($195); one liter ($235) and one and a half liters ($295) -- at Bergdorf Goodman, 754 Fifth Avenue (58th Street). Juicy Salif, Philippe Starck's aluminum citrus juicer in 24-karat gold plate, is a limited edition of 9,999; $199 at Moss, 150 Greene Street (Houston Street).

9. A golden twig place mat is $25, and an Italian glass dessert plate decorated with a gold baroque pattern ($24) and a matching glass tumbler ($18) are at Barneys New York. Tools (knife, fork and spoons) by Mono are 24-karat gold-plated steel. A four-piece place setting is $305 at Moss.
